meanings.definition: A person, typically a young woman, who is famous for being famous.
meanings.sent1: The party was full of celebutantes posing for photos.
meanings.sent2: The magazine cover featured the latest celebutantes in Hollywood.
meanings.sent3: The celebutantes giggled as they tried to outshine each other with their outfits.
meanings.sent4: In the world of social media, she was the reigning celebutante, capturing everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The young celebutantes sparkled under the flashing lights of the red carpet.

meanings.definition: The group of celebrities who are known for their socialite status rather than their professional accomplishments.
meanings.sent1: The exclusive club was filled with wealthy celebutantes mingling at the charity event.
meanings.sent2: The gossip columns were buzzing with news about the latest antics of the celebutantes.
meanings.sent3: The celebutantes caused a stir at the gala with their extravagant entrances.
meanings.sent4: She navigated the social scene with the grace of a seasoned celebutante.
meanings.sent5: The mansion party was a gathering of the most glamorous celebutantes in town.
